Tenant.title: Tenant
Tenant.description: Represents a tenant in the system, isolating data for different organizations or customers.

slug.description: A URL-friendly slug for the tenant.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the tenant was created.

TenantMember.title: TenantMember
TenantMember.description: Represents a user's membership within a tenant, including their role and status.

id.description: Unique identifier for the tenant member.

role.description: The role of the member within the tenant (e.g., tenantOwner, admin, editor, viewer).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the member was added to the tenant.

invitedBy.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N TenantMember) The user who invited this member.

status.description: The status of the membership (e.g., active, invited).

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user synchronized from LDAP or a similar directory service.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user within the tenant.

externalId.description: External identifier from the LDAP directory.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

department.description: The department the user belongs to.

title.description: The job title of the user.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the user is enabled.

lastSyncedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user was last synchronized from LDAP.

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description: Represents a resource within a tenant, such as a SaaS application or internal tool.

type.description: The type of resource (e.g., SaaS, OnPrem, Shop, Tool, Other).

criticality.description: The criticality level of the resource (e.g., low, medium, high).

Entitlement.title: Entitlement
Entitlement.description: Represents an entitlement for a resource, defining the access level or permissions.

name.description: The name of the entitlement (e.g., Viewer, Editor, Admin).

riskLevel.description: The risk level associated with the entitlement (e.g., low, medium, high).

isInheritable.description: Indicates whether this entitlement can be inherited by other entities or hierarchical structures.

Assignment.title: Assignment
Assignment.description: Represents the assignment of an entitlement to a user for a specific resource.

status.description: The status of the assignment (e.g., active, requested, removed).

grantedBy.description: The user who granted the assignment.

grantedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the assignment was granted.

ticketRef.description: Reference to a ticket or request associated with the assignment.

validUntil.description: Timestamp indicating when the assignment is valid until.

AuditEvent.title: AuditEvent
AuditEvent.description: Represents an audit event, logging changes to resources, entitlements, and assignments.

id.description: Unique identifier for the audit event.

actorUid.description: The user who performed the action.

action.description: The action performed (e.g., create, update, delete).

entityType.description: The type of entity that was modified (e.g., resource, entitlement, assignment).

entityId.description: The ID of the entity that was modified.

before.description: The state of the entity before the change (JSON string).

after.description: The state of the entity after the change (JSON string).

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when the event occurred.

PlatformUser.title: PlatformUser
PlatformUser.description: Represents a platform-level user, potentially with superadmin privileges.

id.description: Unique identifier for the platform user.

isSuperAdmin.description: Indicates whether the user has superadmin privileges.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support a multi-tenant application with role-based access control. Each tenant's data is isolated within its own collections, ensuring data privacy and security. Authorization Independence is achieved by storing tenant membership information (role) directly within the `tenantMembers` collection, which avoids costly and insecure `get()` calls in the security rules. Superadmin privileges are checked via a separate `platformUsers` collection, offering an efficient way to bypass tenant-level restrictions when necessary.

The structure supports the required QAPs (Queries Aware Permissions) by:

1.  **Segregation:**  Each tenant's data resides in its own top-level collections (e.g., `tenants/{tenantId}/resources`). This ensures that list operations can be securely performed within a tenant's scope.
2.  **Membership Model:** The `tenants/{tenantId}/members/{uid}` collection explicitly defines the role of each user within a tenant. This model is pivotal for authorization checks in security rules, enabling secure and efficient filtering based on user roles.
